column2: Paper Out The All-In-One is out of paper.
Load paper. If the problem remains, then check the paper sensor; if the paper sensor is ok, then check and/or replace the system board.
Paper Jam There is paper jammed in the All-In-One.
Clear the paper jam, and resend the print job. If the problem remains, then check the All-In-One for foreign objects.
Carrier Jam The carrier is jammed and will not move.

• The carrier slams against the side frame. • There is no carrier movement. • Check the encoder strip for proper installation or contamination. Clean as possible. • Check the carrier cable connectors on the system board. If connectors are okay, then replace the system board. See “System board with media sensor, cable, and spring removal”. If that does not fix the problem, then replace the print engine. See “Print engine removal”. Poor print quality Be sure that the All-In-One contains good print tanks. Be sure the print tank nozzle plate is clean. Clean with a soft cloth. Ink smudging and smearing can be caused by paper problems or problems in the paper feed area. Check for: • Correct type of paper • Curled or wrinkled paper • Paper path obstructions • Feed roller wear or looseness • Worn gears or binds If the paper feed roller or gears are defective, then replace the All-In-One. Blurred print and voids can be caused by problems in the carrier transport area. Check the following: • Carrier transport belt for wear • Idler pulley parts for wear, damage, or looseness • Carrier guide rod for wear or dirt. If the rod is dirty, then clean and lubricate it. The carrier to carrier frame engagement should be lubricated with grease P/N 40X0179. If the carrier transport belt is worn, then replace the print engine. See “Print engine removal”. If the idler pulley parts are defective, then replace the print engine. See “Print engine removal”.
Carrier Jam The carrier is jammed and will not move.

• The carrier slams against the side frame. • There is no carrier movement. • Check the encoder strip for proper installation or contamination. Clean as possible. • Check the carrier cable connectors on the system board. If connectors are okay, then replace the system board. See “System board with media sensor, cable, and spring removal”. If that does not fix the problem, then replace the print engine. See “Print engine removal”. Poor print quality Be sure that the All-In-One contains good print tanks. Be sure the print tank nozzle plate is clean. Clean with a soft cloth. Ink smudging and smearing can be caused by paper problems or problems in the paper feed area. Check for: • Correct type of paper • Curled or wrinkled paper • Paper path obstructions • Feed roller wear or looseness • Worn gears or binds If the paper feed roller or gears are defective, then replace the All-In-One. Blurred print and voids can be caused by problems in the carrier transport area. The carrier to carrier frame engagement should be lubricated with grease P/N 40X0179. If the carrier transport belt is worn, then replace the print engine. See “Print engine removal”. If the idler pulley parts are defective, then replace the print engine. See “Print engine removal”.

• The carrier slams against the side frame. • There is no carrier movement. • Check the encoder strip for proper installation or contamination. Clean as possible. • Check the carrier cable connectors on the system board. If connectors are okay, then replace the system board. See “System board with media sensor, cable, and spring removal”. If that does not fix the problem, then replace the print engine. See “Print engine removal”. Poor print quality Be sure that the All-In-One contains good print tanks. Be sure the print tank nozzle plate is clean. Clean with a soft cloth. Ink smudging and smearing can be caused by paper problems or problems in the paper feed area. Check for: • Correct type of paper • Curled or wrinkled paper • Paper path obstructions • Feed roller wear or looseness • Worn gears or binds If the paper feed roller or gears are defective, then replace the All-In-One. If the idler pulley parts are defective, then replace the print engine. See “Print engine removal”.
Printhead Error The printhead has an error.
Reinstall the print tanks. If the problem remains, then clean the contacts on the printhead. If the problem persists, then replace the printhead.
NVRAM R/W An error was detected in reading or writing NVRAM.

1. Remove the right side cover. See “Right side cover removal”. 2. Remove the left side cover. See “Left side cover removal”. 3. Remove the rear cover. See “Rear cover removal”. 4. Remove the front door/operator panel/camera assembly. See “Front door/operator panel/camera assembly removal”. 5. Disconnect all cables from the system board. 6. Remove the four screws (A) from the system board shield, and the one screw (B) from the system board. 7. Lift the system board, and remove. 8. Remove the media sensor.
Memory Failure Unable to initialize memory.
Replace the system board.
Hardware Failure General hardware failure (unable to localize failure to a specific system).
Replace the system board.
ROM Checksum Failure
Replace the system board.
Paper System Failure. The DC paper feed system fails to initialize or calibrate.
Unplug the All-In-One from the wall outlet; wait a few seconds, then plug the All-In- One back in and turn the power on. Service: Replace the system board.
Print Carrier Stall The All-In-One carrier has stalled.

• The carrier slams against the side frame. • There is no carrier movement. • Check the encoder strip for proper installation or contamination. Clean as possible. • Check the carrier cable connectors on the system board. If connectors are okay, then replace the system board. See “System board with media sensor, cable, and spring removal”. If that does not fix the problem, then replace the print engine. See “Print engine removal”. Poor print quality Be sure that the All-In-One contains good print tanks. Be sure the print tank nozzle plate is clean. Clean with a soft cloth. Ink smudging and smearing can be caused by paper problems or problems in the paper feed area. Check for: • Correct type of paper • Curled or wrinkled paper • Paper path obstructions • Feed roller wear or looseness • Worn gears or binds If the paper feed roller or gears are defective, then replace the All-In-One. Blurred print and voids can be caused by problems in the carrier transport area. Check the following: • Carrier transport belt for wear • Idler pulley parts for wear, damage, or looseness • Carrier guide rod for wear or dirt. If the rod is dirty, then clean and lubricate it. The carrier to carrier frame engagement should be lubricated with grease P/N 40X0179. If the carrier transport belt is worn, then replace the print engine. See “Print engine removal”. If the idler pulley parts are defective, then replace the print engine. See “Print engine removal”.
Paper Jam There is paper jammed in the All-In-One.
Clear the paper jam, and resend the print job.
Paper Out The All-In-One is out of paper.
Load paper. If the problem remains, then check the paper sensor.
Incorrect Printhead Printhead ID is not valid.
Replace the printhead with the correct printhead.
Missing Printhead
Install a printhead.
Printhead Order Unsupported order of printhead.
Install the correct printhead.
Scan Back Alignment Failure Automatic alignment has failed.
Follow the instructions on the computer screen to recover and align the print tanks.
Print Incomplete The print carrier stopped before all of the data was used.
Clear any carrier jams. Unplug the All-In- One from the wall outlet, wait a few seconds, then plus the All-In-One back in and turn the power on. Resend the print job.
Data Error Incorrect data has been sent from the host computer to the All-In-One.

Unplug the All-In-One from the wall outlet; wait a few seconds, then plug the All-In- One back in and turn the power on. If the problem remains, then replace the USB cable. Service: Replace the system board.
Printhead Short The short test detected a short circuit in the printhead.

Remove the printhead. Clean and reinstall the printhead. If this does not correct the problem, then replace the printhead. Service: Remove the printhead. Clean and reinstall the printhead. If this does not correct the problem, then replace the printhead.
Printhead Programming Firmware is unable to program pseudo-random printhead ID.
Replace the printhead.
Mono TSR Error. There is a problem in the color TSR circuit; cannot determine printhead temperature.
Replace the printhead.
Color TSR Error. There is a problem in the color TSR circuit; cannot determine printhead temperature.
Replace the printhead.
Paper System Error A paper system error control failure was detected.

Clear the paper path. Unplug the All-In- One from the wall outlet; wait a few seconds, then plug the All-In-One back in and turn the power on. If the remains, then replace the All-In-One. Service: Replace the system board.
Printhead Memory Error Firmware is unable to read the printhead’s memory.

Clean the contacts. If the problem persists, then replace the printhead. If the problem remains, then replace the All-In- One. Service: Replace the printhead. If the problem remains, then replace the system board.
FLASH Programming Error Could not program FLASH.
The printer will auto reset. If the problem remains, then replace the All-In-One. Service: Replace the printhead.
Undefined Error The microprocessor has encountered an abort or undefined instruction.

Unplug the All-In-One from the wall outlet; wait a few seconds, then plug the All-In- One back in, and turn the power on. If the problem remains, then replace the All-In- One. Service: Replace the system board.
Address Error Firmware attempted to access invalid address space.
Unplug the All-In-One from the wall outlet; wait a few seconds, then plug the All-In- One back in, and turn the power on. Service: Replace the system board.
NVRAM Error An error was detected in reading or writing NVRAM.

Unplug the All-In-One from the wall outlet; wait a few seconds, then plug the All-In- One back in, and turn the power on. If the problem remains, then replace the All-In- One. Service: Replace the system board.
Never Error Stack over and under flow error; Code error.

Unplug the All-In-One from the wall outlet; wait a few seconds, then plug the All-In- One back in, and turn the power on. If the problem remains, then replace the All-In- One. Service: Replace the system board.
Software Detected Error An error condition was detected in the software control code.

Unplug the All-In-One from the wall outlet; wait a few seconds, then plug the All-In- One back in, and turn the power on. If the problem remains, then replace the All-In- One. Service: Reinstall the print driver. If the problem remains, then replace the system board.
Mode Select An invalid print mode was selected in the print command.
Resend the print job. If the problem remains, then reinstall the printer driver. Service: Resend the print job. If the problem remains, then reinstall the print driver.
USB Error An error was detected in USB hardware, or invalid results occurred in USB code.

Unplug the All-In-One from the wall outlet; wait a few seconds, then plug the All-In- One back in and turn the power on. If the problem remains, then replace the USB cable. Service: Replace the USB cable. If the problem remains, then replace the system board.
Watchdog Error Indicates printer system was reset by Watchdog timer; Subsystem stall failure.

Unplug the All-In-One from the wall outlet; wait a few seconds, then plug the All-In- One back in and turn the power on. If the problem remains, then replace the USB cable. Service: Replace the system board.
Data Abort Error Firmware attempted to load or store to an invalid address.

Unplug the All-In-One from the wall outlet; wait a few seconds, then plug the All-In- One back in and turn the power on. If the problem remains, then replace the USB cable. Service: Replace the system board.
Invalid Processor Mode Error Indicates the ARM processor was in an incorrect mode to perform the requested operation.

Unplug the All-In-One from the wall outlet; wait a few seconds, then plug the All-In- One back in and turn the power on. If the problem remains, then replace the USB cable. Service: Replace the system board.
Math Error There is a problem doing math, such as dividing by zero.

Unplug the All-In-One from the wall outlet; wait a few seconds, then plug the All-In- One back in and turn the power on. If the problem remains, then replace the USB cable. Service: Replace the system board.
Mailbox Error Problem with the internal mailbox messaging system.
The printer will auto reset.
Printhead Temperature Error There is a problem determining temperature.
Check and clean the contacts. If the problem persists, then replace the printhead.
Serial Flash Error Invalid parameters have been passed to ReadFlashPage.

Unplug the All-In-One from the wall outlet; wait a few seconds, then plug the All-In- One back in and turn the power on. If the problem remains, then replace the All-In- One. Service: Replace the system board.
Undefined Signal Error Microprocessor has encountered a bad signal (other than an abort, illegal instruction, or arithmetic exception).

Unplug the All-In-One from the wall outlet; wait a few seconds, then plug the All-In- One back in and turn the power on. If the problem remains, then replace the USB cable. Service: Replace the system board.
Loop Timeout Error Error detected that a while loop or similar loop timed out before the event it was waiting on finished.
Unplug the All-In-One from the wall outlet; wait a few seconds, then plug the All-In- One back in, and turn the power on. Service: Replace the system board.
NVRAM Control Section Corrupted. Indicates that the control section of NVRAM is corrupted.
The printer will auto reset.
Internal Firmware Error Firmware encountered an unexpected condition.
Unplug the All-In-One from the wall outlet; wait a few seconds, then plug the All-In- One back in, and turn the power on. Service: Replace the system board.
Internal Firmware Error Firmware encountered an unexpected condition.
Unplug the All-In-One from the wall outlet; wait a few seconds, then plug the All-In- One back in, and turn the power on. Service: Replace the system board.
Internal Firmware Error Firmware encountered an unexpected condition.
Unplug the All-In-One from the wall outlet; wait a few seconds, then plug the All-In- One back in, and turn the power on. Service: Replace the system board.
